metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12419 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
When processing callbacks that occurred during window flushing in theparent process, the associated window may die; causing a use-after-freecondition. This could have led to memory corruption and a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.10, Firefox< 78, and Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12419` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
